alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 14 at 12:27PM CDT until June 14 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM EDT/100 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHERN HENRY AND NORTHWESTERN EARLY COUNTIES... At 125 PM EDT/1225 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Headland, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Headland, Newville, Haleburg, Headland Municipal A/P, Tumbleton, Miller, Grandberry Crossroads, Rock Hill and Balkum. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
